attributes.action: State the amount of sugar in teaspoons on packaging in food and drink products
attributes.additional_details:
The World Health Organisation recommends adults should consume NO MORE than 6 teaspoons of free sugar daily. 

Sugar is the main cause of type 2 diabetes and weight gain. 

Type 2 diabetes costs the NHS more than £8.8bn per year and could bankrupt it. 

The Government has a duty of care to the public on health matters and should be putting prevention first. This is an opportunity for it to honour its election pledge to take a "completely new approach to public health and preventable diseases".
attributes.background: Labelling on the FRONT of food and drink packaging should clearly state how many teaspoons of sugar the product contains in total.  Eg. “This pack contains X teaspoons of sugar”, in order that consumers can make an informed choice about purchasing the product or what size portion to serve.
